title: Corey Worthington unrecognisable with neck tattoos after huge transformation
text:
He is known as the notorious 'party boy' who became a global sensation after throwing an out-of-control party at his parents' house in Melbourne in 2008.

However, Corey Worthington is now barely recognisable from his days as an unlikely teenage icon without his trademark cap, bleached hair and large sunglasses.

These days, Corey, now 28, sports an even more dramatic hairstyle and elaborate neck tattoos.

Remember him? Notorious 'party boy' Corey Worthington (pictured) is now barely recognisable without his trademark cap, bleached hair and large sunglasses from his teenage infamy

Throwback: Corey became a global sensation after throwing an out-of-control party at his parents' house in Melbourne back in 2008

On Monday, the former reality star took to Instagram to showcase his long brown hair tied up in a knot and completely shaven at the sides.

His tattoo collection is now creeping from his neck and onto his face, with what appears to be the horns of an animal covering part of his cheek.

Corey's upper body is also now completely covered with black and white inkings.

Look at him now! On Monday, Corey, now 28, took to Instagram to showcase his long brown hair tied up in a knot and completely shaven at the sides

After finding fame in 2008, Corey starred on Big Brother season eight later that year.

In 2018, he returned to reality television on the second season of Australian Ninja Warrior, debuting his muscular physique.

'Great experience and great people,' he said of his experience on Ninja Warrior.

Famous: After finding fame in 2008, Corey starred on Big Brother season eight later that year. Pictured: Corey with Big Brother hosts Kyle Sandilands and Jackie O in 2008

Last year, Corey told The Fix he has spent a decade trying to live up to his wild reputation after his out-of-control house party went viral.

After publicising the event on Myspace, a reported 500 revelers turned up and the carnage that ensued attracted police helicopters and the dog squad to the property.

'It's been a great ride,' he says proudly of his infamy. 'That's the role I've been chucked into and I owned it as much as I can.'

Swapping partying for the gym! In 2018, Corey returned to reality television on the second season of Australian Ninja Warrior, debuting his newfound buff physique
description: He is known as the notorious 'party boy' who became a global sensation after throwing an out-of-control party at his parents' house in Melbourne in 2008.
authors: Joshua Fox For Daily Mail Australia
